sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of traffic accident occurring on a road
message_1: A city has a total of 5000 cars on its roads. The probability of  accidents involving two or more cars is 0.03. What is the probability that there will be at least one multi-car accident on any given day in this city?
message_2:
To find the probability of at least one multi-car accident, we can first find the probability of no multi-car accidents and then subtract it from 1.

The probability of no multi-car accidents is (1 - 0.03) for each car. Since there are 5000 cars, we need to multiply this probability for all cars:

P(no multi-car accidents) = (1 - 0.03)^5000 ≈ 0.000045

Now, we can find the probability of at least one multi-car accident by subtracting the probability of no multi-car accidents from 1:

P(at least one multi-car accident) = 1 - P(no multi-car accidents) = 1 - 0.000045 ≈ 0.999955

So, the probability of at least one multi-car accident on any given day in this city is approximately 0.999955 or 99.9955%.
